def_cn: (尤指不熟悉或想象中的)生物，动物
def_en: You can refer to any living thing that is not a plant as a creature, especially when it is of an unknown or unfamiliar kind. People also refer to imaginary animals and beings as creatures .
If you say that someone is a particular type of creature, you are focusing on a particular quality they have.  a creature of habit→see: habit;
If you describe someone as someone else's creature, you mean that they are controlled by or depend on that person.
